intro: Raddiella kaieteurana, commonly known as the Kaieteurana raddiella, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and unique morphological features. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
